title: So I see all the complaints about the new HUD but what about the things they did fix?
body:
Just a short list:

1. Added Ult Timers
2. Added Summoners Cooldowns (Have to press tab to see)
3. Adjustable player icons (You can move everybody into there lanes and compare to see who is winning the lane)
4. A trinket timer 
5. Many other things

This is just a small list. Riot listened to the community. If you look at posts from a month ago you will find posts complaining about there not being ult timers. Not being summoners timers and not being able to decipher whether or not your trinket was ready to use. The problem with this community is that we are all pessimists, we all look at the things that we think Riot has messed up instead of looking at the things they have fixed.

replies.body: Nothing wrong with the new HUD. All will be forgotten in a few weeks when the whiners get used to it. Mark my words.
I have a few problems personally.  some aspects lack clarity (took me a long time to figure out where the personal/team scores are and how to look at my stats.

The stats have been getting better for me after just a few games, although I think there's room for improvement.  The issues I'm not getting used to are the blue circles for CDs and how pathetically small the team health bars are.

>
>   The issues I'm not getting used to are the blue circles for CDs 

Thats my biggest issue.  I keep thinking my I'm out of mana when I glance down to check my cooldowns.

Yep.  Had nearly full tank of mana, glance down, icons make me think I had zero mana.  The fact that they're both the same color is appalling.  Why did they ship it through the PBE?  At least make it YELLOW instead of BLUE.

Really a minor issue that is an easy fix, make the two colors easier to differentiate from one another.
On PBE, I never had much issue with telling the two apart, but obviously not everyone sees colors the same and you want to try and avoid undue mistakes due simply to a color.

I wouldn't say that the community is pessimistic.

I would say that a vocal minority of the community is pessimistic and doesn't like the new HUD while the majority either like it or don't particularly care either way.

Thanks for making this post, as I would have had I had the time to do so earlier.

I'm very disappointed in the way the community is responding to this change, not that it surprises me.

Its one thing to provide constructive criticism or provide feedback, but the majority of these posts are simply rude complaints. 

If you have feedback, give it in a civilized manner and offer alternatives, I'm seeing so many posts like "THE NEW HUD SUCKS ASSSSSSSSS", "I HATE THIS NEW HUD IT BLOWS", etc.

The same goes for all this bashing of the Fiora visual update. You people are being absolutely disrespectful to the artist who took the time to draw that splash art. Yes it looks different from the original, that is the point of a visual update. I'm absolutely disgusted how many people are flooding the forums with complaints on it. I personally don't think it looks all that bad, in fact I think its very well done. It is certainly different, but it still looks like Fiora. Again, the manner in which you provide your response to these changes can either make it feedback or disrespectful remarks. 

Feedback is good, distasteful insults are not. 

Nobody will listen to you if you're rude. Please try to be civil.
Is this real life o_o. I've seen so much dirty shit on the boards and I'm so happy to see someone else hates it.
plz link me the very popular forum thread where people asked for a new hud wud ya

I wish the boards would learn what critiques actually are. Instead of pointing out respectively what could be changed, such as with the fiora splash, they use quite harsh words and disrespect the artist and basically say "but that's my opinion so".

The new features are nice, but it's worthless when you can't find that information quickly. Everything on the new HUD is jumbled together and the color contrast is about as bad as it can be. It takes 2-3 seconds to read some of the information, which is a lifetime in League.
Out of curiosity, are you one of the players that frequently looked at the ally portraits, your own base stats or your own KDA? Because that's the only information that feels jumbled together to me.

No, I don't normally look at any of those 3. The new mini map is absolute garbage. You can barely read anything on it. Even the map is harder to read now. The information on the enemy team is insanely bad to try and read now. It's hard to see who is fed, what they are building, etc. 

The new HUD is god awful, they need to disable it and try again. The ONLY thing I like about the new HUD is the death timers for the enemy team.

> [{quoted}](name=Lugg,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=XE0IUvWR,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-07-23T16:59:12.256+0000)
>
> No, I don't normally look at any of those 3. The new mini map is absolute garbage. You can barely read anything on it. Even the map is harder to read now. 

I've noticed a blue tint to the map, and the black outline on minions, but what else changed? As best I can tell, it's the exact same map.

>The information on the enemy team is insanely bad to try and read now. It's hard to see who is fed, what they are building, etc. 

Information where? When you click on them or in the tab menu?

----
I think the problem is that people aren't specifying *what* they're doing and *where* they're trying to get information. I can believe the new UI was designed with fewer use-cases thought through, but unless people can step by step explain where they look, what they expect to see, and why it doesn't work any more, nothing's likely to change.

The blue tint on the minimap makes it hard to read anything on it, even the map is harder to see now. Plus you can't enlarge it as big as before.

The tab menu is what I was talking about. It's probably the worst thing in the new HUD. 

Lately Riot has been doing a horrid job of giving the community what it really wants.
What information did you lose from the Tab menu?
It's not that it lost info, the info got crunched together and is very hard to read now.

^This.  That's the only part I have trouble with, and Shen is one of my most played champs.  Ally portraits are important; I just have to get used to treating the minimap as the source of all global info.

I liked to look over and see my champion stats, as well as look to the upper right corner and see my CS and my KDA. It's rough now, because I still look in those places, and then realize the information I'm looking for is no longer there. I then have to search around for the new location, which wastes time that could be better spent playing the game. Updating visuals is one thing. Moving around entire portions is another.

> [{quoted}](name=Nsqui,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=XE0IUvWR,comment-id=000300000002,timestamp=2015-07-23T20:32:28.281+0000)

It's rough now, because I still look in those places, and then realize the information I'm looking for is no longer there. I then have to search around for the new location, which wastes time that could be better spent playing the game. Updating visuals is one thing. Moving around entire portions is another.

In time you'll get used to the new locations. Reorganizing to improve flow of information is a good thing, but there are some valid complaints about the size of the info. Shrinking it without giving a scale option is a really bad thing overall.

I have no doubt I will get used to it. That, however, does not change the fact that moving around information that had zero reason to be repositioned is a horrible design choice.

Though it never gave me trouble, I can understand that some people noticed the HUD was blocking portions of the map, especially when playing top lane on red side. So be it. As much as I hate the new visual style, I will get used to it, and it serves a valid purpose.

Moving the champion frames, the team score, your current CS, and your KDA, on the other hand, are unnecessary changes to portions of the HUD that were in completely fine, non-game breaking locations.

> 4. A trinket timer 
> 5. Many other things

> This is just a small list. Riot listened to the community. If you look at posts from a month ago you will find posts complaining about there not being ult timers. Not being summoners timers and not being able to decipher whether or not your trinket was ready to use. The problem with this community is that we are all pessimists, we all look at the things that we think Riot has messed up instead of looking at the things they have fixed.

"Many other things" is a horrible vague point to start off, because there aren't that many positive changes but I guess it's an easy way to bolster your viewpoint. No one asked Riot to change the visual layout of the UI.

Riot could have added all of these things without ruining the layout of the old HUD... That is everyone's main issue. It's not like the old HUD was a useless piece of shit that couldn't be improved, it worked for 5 years and to change a UI layout that people enjoy and have used since launch "just because" is a stupid reason to force people who don't like it to use it.

Take WoW's UI for example, the reason why it is so great and has stood the test of time is because people can mod it to the way THEY LIKE IT TO LOOK. What a concept I know

It's different than not agreeing with a balance change; this affects no one but the player playing the game. Why do you care if the other players want an option to tick it back to classic? How does that affect you in any way whatsoever?

Lots of people have asked for riot to change the hud. A lot of people even asked for changing the lay out of the hud. The old hud created advantages and disadvantages for just being on one particular side. Not surprisingly the people complaining about the UI interface are different people then who are currently complaining on boards. On top of that the justifications for changing the lay out of the UI are pretty solid.

Can the Hud be improved on? Absolutely. Did the new hud fix problems from the old hud? Yes.

I like when the game changes. I'm usually excited for patch notes and reworks but this new UI leaves me feeling literally ill after playing a game.

Please riot, I love this game but I really don't think I can continue playing with this hud. Let us choose a "classic UI" option.

The things riot has implemented in the new HUD are great, but were not at the level of efficiency the players have wanted
No hate though, everyones gotta appreciate what riot does, because its not like we could do it better...
But The fixes they added have their drawbacks

1. The ult timers is a pie style timer, and people have requested a time style or (Minute.Seconds) style. On top of this, the pie timers are so small and unreadable just like most things in the new HUD

2. The players wanted summoner CD's to be next to or adjacent to the ult timers for maximum efficiency. Riot stated that they moved death timers to the passive screen (Screen when playing) to negate having to press tab, but players will be just as often pressing tab because of the summoners cooldowns in that section. On top of this, the CD's are barely readable and literally the size of 10 pixels(for most monitors).

3. This addition was great, nothing to complain about here honestly it is perfect. The only thing riot could have done better is the sizing of the tab screen along with the player modules in the tab screen.

4. Trinket timers were a long time needed fix, glad it was fixed though

5. Indeed many other things were ADDED but again, not to their optimal efficiency. Players on the PBE knew that the HUD had amazing potential but needed MANY tweaks before it hit live. If riot were to postpone the premature release of the new HUD until it was at its most optimal state, there would be no hate on it.

I really think the new CD timers are a great idea. The problem is that I'm not going be looking toward my mini map while I play. My eyes are going to be on my character. So if they just put my allies information on the left side of the screen so I can just glance at it really quickly, that'd be perfect.

Otherwise, the new look isn't so bad. I just think a lot of information are clutterd into one space and overall it makes keeping track of my allies difficult.

I don't mind the new HUD. That said, all of those changes could have been made without changing the locations of everything or the look of everything. The biggest complaint that people have is that Riot crammed about 50% of all the information into a single corner which might seem efficient (Only look in one place, see all the info!) but it makes things MUCH more difficult when you're looking for only one thing (finding the HP of a particular ally) and as another poster pointed out it makes poor use of peripheral vision and quick glances.

I think that a lot of stuff will start being "fine" once people are used to it, but I don't think anybody would be unhappy if they just moved everything back to their original locations even with the new assets (maybe make some things larger) and the community would be ECSTATIC if they just put in the work to allow everything to be moved and resized freely. I don't know how much work that would be, but I know a lot of people would love to just rotate the ally champion portraits to vertical and stick them to the left.

give us a option to use the old HuD

boom done

Sorry but I think it's a terrible change.  Yes there are some things that are nice but it seems like for every nice thing that added they made mistakes in other areas.  By far the 2 things that annoy me the most are:

1.  I can't move anything around, I want to play the game and adjust the UI the way I like, why am I stuck with what some Riot nerd thinks I like?  Why in 2015 am I stuck with a UI that I can basically do nothing with?  That's unacceptable.

2.  They changed the voice of the in game announcer to a man, for me it comes off to aggressive.  For a game where you have to be 100% focused to play at a high level is very distracting to have it talk shit to you.  If I wanted that experience I'd just join the trolls.  The female voice was fine before.. well with that said the old UI was perfectly fine.

I really feel for the pro gamers who have trying to prepare for the world finals, what terrible timing by Riot.
I don't like the sound effect when buying stuff anymore :_; not satisfactory

Ok so ive had time to subside my rage. Its.... ok.

That is my biggest issue before anything. Why change something that was fine instead of just improving on the last model. This is half baked and they have admitted it. That is the issue.

The tab menu is better the minimap isnt as clear around the edges of the unwalkable terrain and the clutter of information at the bottom right is too miniscule to be used effectively, and even feels like it is in the wrong location for what it is trying to convey. All the info on the botton right (except the cd timers on ult which i admit is great to know) is better off in the top where it use to be as a center focal point of the game itself. This includes cs, kda, team kda, game timer and baron/dragon timers. The items slot needs to be on the left as a side bar if you want to make it look cool.

AND I HATE HATE HATE THAT B ICON. WTF IS THAT THERE FOR. WHY DO I HAVE TO TAB TO SEE MY TP TIMER AS A TOP LANER? Very inefficient use of space is basically my second gripe about this new hud

redit: Oh almost forgot. Hieroglyphics for the c button stats. What are these symbols and why must i roll over to see that.

Also it would be nice to have the stats that are getting boosted highlighted in case youre not sure what rune page you picked. For example old hud would leave unaffected stats after runes and items white while the one that were yellow.

Just seeing if they'll at least fix this hud when I know they've already demonstrated they dont care to revert it (even though the last one was fine although artistically outdated.)
But when everything they "fixed"  is unreadable they didn't fix it. I CAN NOT read half of the new things and some of the old are indescribable without glasses.

I like the new HUD, It lets me see the ult timers of my team so I can coordinate with my team better in fights, I can see when I can't use an ablity because of an enemy's effect, I can compare my CS to my opponents by just clicking on them and not having to press tab and I have better vision of my level bar so I can see how much more ex I need to level up. In my opinion the size of the stats should be increased so I can see them better and the main stats (AD, AP, Armor, MR, etc.).
Those aren't timers, but glorified loading bars that give you only a crude estimate.
True, but at least I have a better estimate of when I can engage and use my ult and have an ally coordinate their's with mine rather than guess or wait until I see a green dot.

All they had to do was to add a numerical countdown.
Instead they took it, fucked with a sledgehammer and said it's good.
